audioText: Il a échoué à l'examen, pourtant il avait beaucoup étudié pour se préparer.
question: What does the speaker say about his exam performance?
options: He had studied a lot to prepare for it
He didn't study at all for the exam
He was expecting to fail the exam
He took the wrong exam by mistake
explanation: The text states 'Il a échoué à l'examen, pourtant il avait beaucoup étudié pour se préparer.' - He failed the exam, yet he had studied a lot to prepare for it. 'Pourtant' means 'however' or 'yet' and introduces a contrast. The distractors test misinterpretation of study habits (didn't study at all), misinterpretation of expectations (expecting to fail), and misinterpretation of the exam itself (took the wrong exam).
